src:
Alpinesset om dramaet: - Jeg var i sjokk
Emelie Wikström ble for kort tid siden utsatt for et tyveri.
02 Nov 2019, 06:54 by Marthe Ihle
Den svenske alpinstjerna (27) fikk en turbulent start på sesongen, da en mann tok seg inn i hennes og kjæresten Robins hotellrom før sesongstarten i østerrikske Sölden forrige måned.
Overfor Aftonbladet forteller Wikström om dramaet.
- Jeg var i sjokk. Det var så ubehagelig.
Var på rommet
Hun forteller at hun og kjæresten var ute og spiste på restaurant, for så å hente jakkene i garderoben og går for kvelden.

- Samtidig gikk en mann i baren, det virket som han var litt for beruset. Vi gikk kanskje et halvminutt etter ham, og da vi tok ham igjen, drev han og fiklet med en sykkel, sier Wikström.

Hun sier at hun og kjæresten tok et glass på et annet sted før de trakk seg tilbake til hotellet. Ved døra, innså hun at nøkkelkortet var vekk. Etter å ha bedt om et nytt i resepsjonen og fikk kommet inn på rommet, ble de altså sjokkerte:
- Jeg krasjer med en mann som kommer ut av rommet. Jeg trodde vi hadde feil nøkkel, men jeg ser at det er våre bager som ligger der og at lommeboka mi lå åpen.
Ubehagelig
Mannen kjente hun igjen: Det var den samme som hadde forlatt restauranten samtidig som henne og kjæresten. Så langet de ut etter mannen.
Politiet ble tilkalt. Det viste seg at mannen hadde fått med seg noen thailandske baht og et flaxlodd.

- Jeg var i sjokk, det var så ubehagelig. Det var «drama deluxe», sier hun.

Wikström er en av flere svenske alpinister som skal fylle tomrommet etter Pernilla Wiberg og Anja Pärsson. Så langt har det bare lykkes sånn passe.
Hennes beste resultat i verdenscupen er en åttendeplass fra Åre i 2015, men hun klarte å karre med seg en sjetteplass i slalåm fra OL i Sotsji.
text:
The alpiness about the drama: - I was in shock
Emelie Wikström was recently convicted of theft.
02 Nov 2019, 06:54 by Marthe Ihle
The Swedish alpine star (27) got off to a turbulent start to the season, when a man entered her and girlfriend Robin's hotel room before the season launch in Austrian Sölden last month.
Facing Aftonbladet, Wikström tells about the drama.
- I was in shock. It was so uncomfortable.
Was in the room
She tells us that she and her boyfriend were out eating at a restaurant, then picking up their jackets in the wardrobe and going for the evening.

- At the same time, a man went to the bar, it seemed like he was a little too drunk. We went for him maybe half a minute, and when we took him again, he drove and got a bike, says Wikström.

She says she and her boyfriend took a glass at another location before retiring to the hotel. At the door, she realized that the key card was gone. After asking for a new one at the reception and getting into the room, they were shocked:
- I crash with a man coming out of the room. I thought we had the wrong key, but I see that it is our bags lying there and that my wallet was open.
Unpleasant
The man she recognized: It was the same who had left the restaurant at the same time as her and her boyfriend. Then they looked for the man.
The police were called. It turned out that the man had brought some Thai baht and a flax bell.

- I was in shock, it was so uncomfortable. It was "drama deluxe," she says.

Wikström is one of several Swedish mountaineers to fill the void after Pernilla Wiberg and Anja Pärsson. So far it has only succeeded so well.
Her best result in the World Cup is eighth place from Åre in 2015, but she managed to take with her a sixth place in the slalom from the Sochi Olympics.
